WRITING.TEXT: Wait, WHERE does he want that Empire State Building statue to go? I didn't catch that.
This.
Thanks. I'll look into better trinkets. My armor is always within about 5 levels of my character. I'm currently level 49 after playing last night, and I just purchased level 50 armor.
I have the same problem in lower level areas.
Thank you for the tips! I'll definitely use Signet of the Hunt now. Gear-wise I'm using exactly that. I've been told to focus on power, precision, and toughness.

Thanks! I'm glad I'm not the only one who feels this way. I've received some great tips here and I'm sure I'll noticed a difference when I change some of my stats and gear. I swap weapon sets all the time, and I use my pet efficiently. I think I'm in this weird low trait area at the moment. I'm almost level 50, and maybe once I get more traits things will get better.

And that's why I came to this lovely community for help! I've had a few offers to watch me play. Perhaps that will be the best medicine. I think I could change up some stats and gear. Maybe try a different weapon or skill. But I feel like i'm not a total idiot out there. I have a plan when I attack, and I dodge and anticipate foes counter spells. The main problem is that I can't handle events alone and it seems that once I've killed a mob in an area that they are re-spawning so quickly.

Really useful tips. Thanks! I was riding smooth, until about level 40. That's when things started to get tougher and I just couldn't seem to keep up. I've been so partial to my longbow and great sword, but perhaps I need to switch that up. Thanks again!

I do have trinkets. They add to my power, precision, and toughness. I do use my traits, mainly in power. I've been told to steer clear of condition damage in this thread though. So, ?
I use dodge constantly, guys. I can't seem to say this enough. Good tip, but i'm already all over that. I NEVER try to take on more than 3 foes at a time. My pet goes first and tanks, while I use my longbow. The problem is that things keep re-spawning while I'm still in a fight, thus adding multiple foes to my 2 or 3. That's when it gets overwhelming.

I don't go around pulling all the mobs. I try to slowly take them out one by one. I don't know why people think I'm just Leroy Jenkins-ing it up. I'm very cautious and I let my pet tank for the most part. It's when, say, I'm in a cave and I'm going through clearing. I kill about 5 foes in my area, and see some mushroom to gather. Before I'm done gathering, 5 more have re-spawned almost right on top of me. Then I just get overwhelmed by them.

Playing my Ranger has been fine up until about level 40. It's a pretty simple character to play. I send in my pet to aggro, deal some damage, I stand back with my bow and that's usually all she wrote. But lately I just seem to be overwhelmed with foes. I'll go through a cave and clear our some skrit, but before I'm done killing the 3 in my area, 4 more have re-spawned. Sometimes right on top of me. That's when it gets tough, as I've already used most of my skills, spells and they're all recharging when the calvary arrives.
Oh, I [run away](http://blog.chron.com/tubular/files/2014/05/run-away.jpg) quite frequently. But yes, I just purchased new level 50 armor that I'll get in soon. It has more power and precision.

Good tips. I'll be upgrading my armor next level to get more power, ferocity, toughness. I'll try changing up my healing spells. I don't feel like I'm overly immobile. I stand back with my long bow, let my pet knock em down a few notches, then I'll swoop in with my great sword. I do just fine in most skirmishes, it's when there are just so many baddies, I can't take them all. They just seem to swarm and before I can finish killing them, more have re-spawned.
Perhaps it is the way I play. I just think it's weird that none of this was a problem until I reached about level 40.

I dodge all the time and I know how my foes attack. I've timed my attack so that my pet takes most of the aggro and I'm good about switching my pet and weapon in the middle of a fight. I keep my armor up to date, and I'll have level 50 armor next level.

Someone else also mentioned going with power and toughness. I'm almost to level 50, and I've already purchased my next gear and it's dumped the condition damage, and replaced it with power. I'll also add some toughness. Thanks!
Yes, that's been my main problem. I can't seem to complete these simple events/bosses is lower level areas because I seem to be the only person around.
I should probably take better advantage of food. I rarely use it now. I have runes in all of my gear, but perhaps they are not the ideal ones for me.

I'm on the cusp of leveling up to 50, and I've already purchased my next gear. I get new armor every 5 levels or so, so I really don't think that's my problem. And I did the best I could in linking my gear at the top.

Good tips! I'll try to upgrade my power and toughness in my gear. I was trying to explore lower levels, discover points of interest, vistas, skill points, etc. But I seem to also struggle in lower levels due to downleveling. I've had people here tell me to go to the lower areas, and I've had people tell me to stick to my proper level area. ?
It is, thanks.
Yes, there are all within my level and they are all upgraded with runes/stones.
I could probably take better advantage of this. Thanks
I am, thanks!
I really don't move all around. They swarm, we fight, they die. Before we can even get out of the area, they've all re-spawned.
Thank you for your tips. Especially the bloodlust.
I updated at the top. I hope this helps!
I seem to have trouble in those areas, too. Just too many baddies all at once.
I've got one

My armor is current with my level, all slots contain upgrades. I switch between a bear and a wolf pet and use Sic Em. I have a lightning reflexes which propel me backward, and Point Blank Shot which propels them backward.
I use the crap out of my pet and I'm usually very aware of where I'm standing compared to combat and other baddies.

WRITING.TITLE: Need help: I'm lvl 47 yet I seem to keep dying when I play alone
WRITING.TEXT:
I'm a lvl 48 Ranger and no matter where I go (within my range or lower) I just keep getting my ass kicked. Am I basically force to partner with other players? It seems that everything aggros on me, not just one or two, but 6-10. Everything re-spawns so quickly that by the time I'm killing my last foe (having barely stayed alive) fresh baddies appear right on top of me. The game has become increasingly frustrating. I used to play alone and I leveled just fine, but over the past few levels I just can't keep from dying. Am I doing something wrong?
**Edit:** Here's a little bit about my Ranger. She loves to sing, enjoys long walks on the beach at sunset, and loves to drink.
Weapons: [Honed Iron Greatsword of Fire](http://www.gw2spidy.com/item/27513), [Honed Soft Wood Longbow of the Hydromancer](http://www.gw2spidy.com/item/28518)
Pet: Bear/Wolf....Shark when aquatic BECAUSE ITS COOL
Skills: Healing Spring, Sic 'Em/Protect Me, Rampage As One, Lightning Reflexes, Call Wurm
Armor: Honed Swindler Mask of Lyssa, [Ravaging Privateer Shoulders of Lyssa](http://www.gw2spidy.com/item/976), Ravaging Privateer Coat of the Dolyak, [Ravaging Privateer Gloves of the Dolyak](http://www.gw2spidy.com/item/1970), Ravaging Privateer Pants of Lyssa, Ravaging Privateer Boots of the Dolyak
That's the basic setup. The areas that are giving me a hard time are Lornar's Pass (25-40) and where my story is leading me, Gendarran Fields (25-35), and Bloodtide Coast (45-55).
I hope that clears a lot of things up for you guys. Thank you all for your help and care. You guys are awesome!
**Edit 2:** Just wanted to thank all of you for your help and suggestions. You are a gracious community!
Yeah, little Nolan is tearin' it up.

WRITING.TITLE: I think they did a great job matching up young Nucky with young Steve Buscemi

WRITING.TEXT: It's season 5. How is Mickey still alive?
I just now noticed the detail in her bodice looks like a dragon flying. Great job!

Oh man, that armor is cool. She has Drogon armor. I was reading the Princess and the Queen about the Targaryen civil war, and what I loved most about it were the Targ riders and their dragons in battle. It was so commonplace then to have dragons fighting, which seems so odd currently. I liked hearing about their armor, helms, saddles, etc. I really, really enjoyed this picture you made. She reminds me of the Targaryens of old. Well done!
I said, "I can't wait for Chalky to kill that guy."
I meant MY wound.
So much. So much happened.
I have said this multiple times throughout this episode. If I could sum it up in one phrase, it would be HOLY SHIT
Chalky said BOOM!
I've really enjoyed watching young Nucky.
Back when people used to shoot themselves instead of the office.
I was cursing HBO for showing it again. Damn them. I thought the wound had started to heal...
That was a grim recap.

Instantly reminded me of [Augustus St. Cloud's place](http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-FrgPDzr28q0/Ua9rijYKniI/AAAAAAAAIUw/OmUvkCq-X50/s1600/the-venture-bros-what-color-is-your-cleansuit-augustus-and-guild-members-1920px.jpg)
He's beautiful and he looks like he's a total bastard. Perfect!
I love their faces. The moment is captured so well. They are both so sad, so trapped.
That is incredible. I hope you made her Mrs. Girlfriend after this!
It costs too much to do this trick today.
People disgust me.
I think you guys are doing a great job with the updates! If someone doesn't like the WaPo article, then they need to take it up with WaPo, not you.
That was delightful.
This is some really great footage. The power. The curiosity.
Finally. A cookbook for every day of the week!
Makes me wish she was going to be in the show...
Saliterrier
If I had a time machine, I would use it to go back to see live performances like this that I would have missed.
I think I'm a long lost relative. These are my people.
I'm sad that we've finally reached the last season. It's been a wonderful show and I can't wait to see what this last season has in store for us.
Aces!
Werrrrnstrom!
That is the most handsome Jon Snow I've ever seen. Well done.
He finally grew a real pair.
Good comparison.
That look was greatness. He looks so satisfied that he went up against this character of chaos and won. Don't get cocky, Lester.
Lester should go into selling *wife* insurance.

There were only 2 blood trails in the snow (Key Peele). When Lester follows Malvo's blood trail through the house and out to the driveway, we see Malvo's blood leads to the FBI's car and the car is missing. When the camera pans up we also see that Malvo's DLR FBI car is gone. To me, that means Malvo let the guy go, and took the agents car.
I bought this print yesterday. Only $20!
Aces.
I'd get a 23% raise.
He let the duct taped car salesman go!
True Detective?

I assumed the wolf showed up because of the blood trail Malvo had left. I like how Malvo looked at the wolf, as if he was recognizing the animal he is and related to the wolf/predator. I think he knew it'd be his end soon.
Lester getting nailed in the face with his own award was so gratifying.
I want to go to there even though they're not Mantas. Still, very lovely.
Take my money!
Arya gets to see Ice again!

WRITING.TITLE: My friend's wife passed out before 9pm and no amount of shaking will wake her.

WRITING.TEXT: Those are awesome. I'd throw money at those for sure! Tom looks so dapper.
It's pretty apparent that Lester is an idiot.
His spirit animal is the honey badger.
I was genuinely surprised that the head smack didn't work. It always works in movies and shows. Looks like Lester thought the same.
That's exactly what they were going for. I don't think you're reading too much into it, at all. He is the angel of death and chaos.

I thought it was interesting that Lester only booked a one-way ticket for himself. He knew what was going to happen.
Is this really what you want, Lester?
I think that was the point of this shot. He is the angel of chaos and death.

There was so much intensity that entire episode. I was on the edge of my seat expecting the worse at any moment. She shot of Malvo when Lester runs away from the elevator, the shot that seems to be in the side bar is absolutely beautiful. The silhouette, the dead bodies, the blood spatter like a pair of angels wings. Even the long camera shot down the Vegas hotel hallway, shadows dancing all around them as they frantically run to the elevator... perfect. Just perfect. I love this show.

I've always wondered this. There are so many other places/people that would seem like a better idea than kids in a school. But then again, most of the time the shooter is a kid which usually means peers. So sad. It's unbelievable how often this happens now.
Is there a 24 subreddit? I've been searching, but I can't seem to find one.
His fight scene was great. I was really impressed with how well he moved.
[I promise. I will never die}(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8yaTCXcvTGY)
That continuous shot during the fight at the Wall was beautiful.
Ygritte has a higher kill count than Jack Bauer. Damn, girl.
Katy! Yeah, girl!

The damn roads. Traffic has become a constant no matter the time of day. Denton roads were never meant to handle this many people. And what's worse is that there's nothing that can feasibly be done about it.
I feel better now.
Agreed. Even though I knew what was coming it was still really hard to watch. I think I actually felt sadder watching it than reading it. Pedro was a wonderful Viper. I'll miss his charisma so much.
Hahaha. Greatness. I think I'll be getting that for a friend's birthday... who doesn't watch the League.
Too soon.
That was beyond gruesome.
Not a cleaving as much as a squishing.

"Time for Robyn...to leave the nest."
Well, with a pun like that, we'll have to listen to him.
The first time I've seen Littlefinger sweat.
Damn, it's good to see Ned again.
"Oh that was fun." I don't think the deer agrees with you.
The banana scale is no longer a viable unit of measure.
Have all of my upvotes.
"Yaaaay. Malaria...That's our favorite..."
I laughed way too hard at this.

Oh, yes. That is really cool. Do want.
